page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: EVER SINCE ROMAN TIMES NORTHWICH AND ITS SURROUNDING AREAS HAS BEEN LINKED TO SALT.SALT IS THE REASON WHY THE TOWN IS HERE.THERE IS A SALT MUSEUM WHICH SHOWS HOW THE INDUSTRY HAS DEVELOPED FROM EARLY DAYS TO THE PRESENT DAY PROCESSES. ALL AROUND NORTHWICH THERE ARE EXAMPLES OF HOW THE SALT INDUSTRY HAS LEFT ITS MARK ON THE LANDSCAPE.THERE ARE "FLASHES" OR WASTE AREAS WHERE NOTHING WILL GROW,MERES WHERE BRINE PUMPING HAS CAUSED THE COLLAPSE OF THE LAND AND NUMEROUS BUILDINGS WHICH HAVE SUNK.THE WHITE LION HOTEL IN THE TOWN CENTRE HAS SUNK ONE FLOOR SO THAT THE PRESENT GROUND FLOOR WAS ORIGINALLY THE FIRST FLOOR AND THE PRESENT CELLAR HAS WINDOWS AND DOORS WHICH DON'T LEAD ANYWHERE. AT PRESENT THE SALT INDUSTRY HAS MOVED MAINLY TO NEARBY WINSFORD AND{MIDDLEWICH.
